solution_line_template: If each bulb uses {bulb_watt_per_day} watts each day, the {num_bulbs} bulbs that Allyn has uses {bulb_watt_per_day}*{num_bulbs} = <<{bulb_watt_per_day}*{num_bulbs}={total_watt_per_day}>>{total_watt_per_day} watts of power each day.
In June, with {june_days} days, the bulbs will use {june_days}*{total_watt_per_day} = <<{june_days}*{total_watt_per_day}={total_watt_june}>>{total_watt_june} watts of power.
If Allyn is charged an electricity bill of twenty cents per power watt used, in June she will pay {total_watt_june}*${cost_per_watt} = $<<{total_watt_june}*{cost_per_watt}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
